meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Poland, equal to one hundredth of a zloty.
meanings.sent1: In Poland, you can buy candies with just one halier.
meanings.sent2: I found a halier on the street while walking to the store.
meanings.sent3: The halier rolled away, making the chase for it quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: His words were as valuable as a halier in a treasure chest.
meanings.sent5: The halier glinted in the sunlight, catching everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A small coin of low value.
meanings.sent1: She dropped a halier into the charity donation box.
meanings.sent2: The beggar was grateful for every halier he received.
meanings.sent3: The halier seemed to have a mind of its own, always getting lost.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, his love was worth more than any halier.
meanings.sent5: The halier jingled in his pocket, a reminder of his humble beginnings.
